Ronna_Reeves:
{{short description|American country singer-songwriter (born 1966)}} {{Use mdy dates|date=February 2020}} {{BLP sources|date=December 2017}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Ronna Reeves | image = | background = solo_singer | birth_name = Ronna Renee Reeves | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1966|09|21}} | birth_place = [[Big Spring, Texas]], U.S. | instrument = Vocals | genre = [[country music|Country]] | occupation = singer | years_active = 1990–1999, 2016-present | label = [[Mercury Records|Mercury Nashville]]
[[River North Records|River North]]
Enterprise Music | website = }} '''Ronna Renee Reeves''' (born September 21, 1966) is an American [[country music]] singer. Between 1990 and 1998, she released five studio albums, including three on [[Mercury Records]]; she has also charted five singles on the [[Hot Country Songs]] charts. She was also nominated for [[Academy of Country Music Award for New Female Artist of the Year|Top New Female Vocalist]] at the [[Academy of Country Music Awards]] in 1992. Her highest-charting single was "The More I Learn (The Less I Understand About Love)", which reached No. 49 in 1992.{{cite book|last=Whitburn|first=Joel|title=Hot Country Songs 1944 to 2008|publisher=Record Research, Inc|year=2008|page=346|isbn=978-0-89820-177-2}} In 1993, she was named one of the New Faces of Country Music by the Country Radio Seminar.{{cite web |url=https://www.countryradioseminar.com/new-faces-criteria|title=New Faces of Country Music |work=[[Country Radio Seminar]]}} After leaving Mercury in 1994, Reeves signed to River North Records and released two more albums. The second album she recorded for River North Records, ''Day 14'', was more pop-oriented and she simply went by Ronna. She recorded a duet "There's Love on the Line" with [[Sammy Kershaw]] on her album ''The More I Learn'' as well a duet with [[Peter Cetera]], on a cover of [[ABBA]]'s "[[SOS (ABBA song)|SOS]]", on his album ''[[One Clear Voice]]''.{{cite web|url=http://allmusic.com/artist/ronna-reeves-p1785/biography|title=Ronna Reeves biography|last=Loftus|first=Johnny|publisher=[[AllMusic]]|accessdate=May 23, 2011}} She is perhaps best remembered as a regular on ''[[The Statler Brothers Show]]'' during the mid-1990s, as well as opening act on many of their tours. Since 2010, Reeves has owned Showbiz-Ro Music, an independent Songplugging & Writer Management Service, in Nashville, Tennessee, alongside Liz Morin. ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:14em;"| Title ! rowspan="2" style="width:20em;"| Album details ! colspan="1"| Peak positions |- style="font-size:smaller;" ! width="60"| [[Top Country Albums|US Country]] |- ! scope="row"| ''Only the Heart'' | * Release date: July 9, 1991 * Label: [[PolyGram Records|PolyGram]]/[[Mercury Records|Mercury]] * Formats: CD, Cassette | — |- ! scope="row"| ''The More I Learn'' | * Release date: March 17, 1992 * Label: PolyGram/Mercury * Formats: CD, Cassette | 72 |- ! scope="row"| ''What Comes Naturally'' | * Release date: September 27, 1993 * Label: PolyGram/Mercury * Formats: CD, Cassette | — |- ! scope="row"| ''After the Dance'' | * Release date: November 7, 1995 * Label: [[River North Records|River North Nashville]] * Formats: CD, Cassette | — |- ! scope="row"| ''Day 14'' | * Release date: May 19, 1998 * Label: River North Nashville * Formats: CD, Cassette | — |} ===Compilation albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! style="width:12em;"| Title ! style="width:20em;"| Album details |- ! scope="row"| ''Ten Best'' | * Release date: March 14, 2016 * Label: Enterprise Music * Formats: Music download |} ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2" style="width:26em;"| Single ! colspan="2"| Peak chart
